algorithm_technique: Iterate through all 8 directions, checking for a valid 'good line' formation.
problem_summary_simple: Is placing a piece of a certain color on an empty cell a legal move in a board game?
problem_summary_technical: Check if a move creates a 'good line' (3+ same-colored endpoints, opposite colors in between) on an 8x8 board.
key_insights: A move is legal if it forms a 'good line' with the new piece as an endpoint.
A 'good line' requires at least three cells: the new piece, at least one opposite-colored piece, and then the same color piece at the end.
We need to check all 8 directions from the move's position to see if any form a valid line.
